content.description: Boulder move off the ground to a gear placement in a horizontal, then continue up the face trending right to the first of three bolts. tricky left facing corner moves to get established in the roofs above, wind up and crank a big move over the roof to a stance. small gear placements in horizontals protect well throughout the technical face climb to the lower off anchor above.
content.protection: Standard rack, double in fingers, tiny cams...
content.location: Roughly in the center of the cliff and 20 feet left of the bolted line "social bully"12b.

climbs.name: Thwarthog
climbs.fa: Todd Swain, Pete Yost, Pete Axelson. 1983

content.description:
Although the approach and finding the route can be a little troublesome, this route offers some great climbing, nice exposure, and a good dose of seclusion. If you're one who likes a good adventure then this is a great choice. I think finding the route was the crux of the day.   

  Pitch 1: Climb up and to the right to a blank corner. Climb the corner (Bolt), continue up good holds to a roof and then move right to a large ledge. (80')  

  Pitch 2: climb up and left utilizing some horizontals. Apparently there was an old ice screw   which gives the route its name, but I could not find it. Shoot for a small right facing corner at the left end of a roof. steep moves up and to the left lead out of the corner. Then head up and left  aiming for a short finger crack which climbs to a tree on the top.
content.protection: Standard rack to #3 camalot I found wires to be very useful. One bolt on the first pitch and a fixed nut on the second
content.location: This route is located towards the left end of the far cliff. There are a few ways to find the climb, You could rappel from the lookouts the the trail leads to, or bushwhack from the lower trail through the woods.   I had to move to a different area of the cliff and rappel down with two 60 meter ropes

content.description: Traverse left across face to reach the steep headwall, clip third bolt long.Start up into the right leaning crack with sustained moves and a few shake outs along the way.Hit the roof grab some buckets and shoot for the chains. Optional finger size gear placements going to the anchor
content.protection: Bolts and  a couple finger size pieces for the topout
content.location: Same start as Whipping post, on the left end of the far cliff In the orange rock zone.

content.description: Pitch1.10a  The first pitch climbs the face twenty feet left of "pressure drop". off the ground follow flakes up to the right side of a roof. clip the first bolt over the roof and tread lightly to the right, up and over a large wedged flake feature. weave your way up the face plugging in gear along the way to a two bolt anchor in a small scoop.  Pitch 2. 11a (can be linked if slings were extended). Stepping right of the anchor, pull up and over a small overlap/roof hitting positive hand holds above. Some fun exposure into steeper terrain finally pushes you out left to the finishing moves and a two bolt anchor.if you linked pitch1 and pitch 2  together and plan on lowering off you must stop at the first anchor on the way down, pull the rope, rethread and continue lowering.

Climb the face passing a single bolt on your way up to the left side of a roof. tiptoe onto a spike of rock to gain the layback moves (crux, bolt) through the roof. continue up the face above heading right and NOT passing up any gear placements along the way. two bolt anchor
content.location: 30 feet left of the massive corners of "pressure drop"

content.description: A complex cliff separated from the Main Cliff by a saddle or small ravine.
